intro: Othocallis koenigii, commonly known as Indian cumin or Kasuri methi, is an aromatic herb native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its seeds, which are used as a spice, have a distinctively pungent and earthy flavor. Othocallis koenigii is often cultivated for its culinary and medicinal properties.
